sentence.text: Mutations in four genes (intestinal cholesterol absorption, positive regulation of macrophage derived foam cell differentiation, negative regulation of receptor recycling and LDLRAP1) account for the majority of cases with familial hypercholesterolemia.

entity.text: positive regulation of macrophage derived foam cell differentiation

sentence.text: Here in, we review the recent evidence of association of the genetic variants with hypercholesterolemia and the three lipid negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; total cholesterol (TC), HDL-cholesterol (HDL-C) and LDL-cholesterol (LDL-C), their biological pathways and the associated pathogenetic mechanisms.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Nearly 80 genes involved in lipid metabolism (encoding structural components of lipoproteins, lipoprotein receptors and related proteins, enzymes, lipid transporters, lipid transfer proteins, and activators or inhibitors of protein function and gene transcription) with single nucleotide variants (SNVs) that are recognized to be associated with hypercholesterolemia and serum lipid negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II in genome-wide association studies and candidate gene studies were identified.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
